hints.content:
There are $\maroonD{4}$ rows of $\blueD{10}$ penguins.

![Same image with the rows numbered 1  through 4 and the penguins in the row numbered 1 through 10](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1159fcbbf4b9c789ff05c23eae3293bd2fff9539)

options.explanation:
$\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{10}=\maroonD{4}\blueD{\text{ tens}}$.

That's the same as $\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ tens}}+\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ tens}}$.

![The same image with a dividing line making 2 rows of 10 on the top, labeled 2 tens, and 2 rows of 10 on the bottom labeled, 2 tens](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f00495e9ebaccc22a4051a8e8694f99f5cb6d051)

There are $\redD{20}+\purpleC{20}=\greenD{40}$ total penguins.

So $\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{10}=\greenD{40}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the array below to help solve the equation.*   

$4 \times 10 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]
